Package io.github.sanyarnd.standardpaths

Class StandardPaths

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.sanyarnd.standardpaths.StandardPaths
  • public final class StandardPaths
extends Object
    Collection of methods, which return paths to the most common system locations.

    Paths in methods' documentation are examples.
    Internal implementation will always do its best utilizing system API and retrieve the real path.

    Author:
    Alexander Biryukov

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static @NotNull Path cache()
      Directory which can use used to store runtime/cache data: Win: %USERPROFILE%/AppData/Local; Unix: $XDG_CACHE_HOME (default: $HOME/.cache). Usually you'd like to invoke resolve("<appname>") on return value to create subdirectory.
      static @NotNull Path config()
      Directory which can use used to store configuration data: Win: %USERPROFILE%/AppData/Local; Unix: $XDG_CONFIG_HOME (default: $HOME/.config). Usually you'd like to invoke resolve("<appname>") on return value to create subdirectory.
      static @NotNull Path data()
      Directory which can use used to store data: Win: %USERPROFILE%/AppData/Roaming; Unix: $HOME/.local/share. Note that Windows will sync changes with domain server.
      static @NotNull Path dataLocal()
      Directory which can use used to store data: Win: %USERPROFILE%/AppData/Local; Unix: $HOME/.local/share. Usually you'd like to invoke resolve("<appname>") on return value to create subdirectory.
      static @NotNull Path desktop()
      Desktop directory: Win: %USERPROFILE%/Desktop; Unix: ~/Desktop.
      static @NotNull Path documents()
      Documents directory: Win: %USERPROFILE%/Documents; Unix: ~/Documents.
      static @NotNull Path downloads()
      Downloads directory: Win: %USERPROFILE%/Downloads; Unix: ~/Downloads.
      static @NotNull Path home()
      Current user Home directory: Win: %USERPROFILE%; Unix: ~.
      static @NotNull Path music()
      Music directory: Win: %USERPROFILE%/Music; Unix: ~/Music.
      static @NotNull Path pictures()
      Pictures directory: Win: %USERPROFILE%/Pictures; Unix: ~/Pictures.
      static @NotNull Path temp()
      Temp files directory: Win: %USERPROFILE%/AppData/Local/Temp; Unix: /tmp.
      static @NotNull Path videos()
      Videos directory: Win: %USERPROFILE%/Videos; Unix: ~/Videos.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • cache

        @NotNull
public static @NotNull Path cache()
        Directory which can use used to store runtime/cache data:
        • Win: %USERPROFILE%/AppData/Local;
        • Unix: $XDG_CACHE_HOME (default: $HOME/.cache).
        Usually you'd like to invoke resolve("<appname>") on return value to create subdirectory.
        Returns:
        path to runtime/cache directory
        Throws:
        NoSuchPathException - if it's impossible to acquire path to directory

      • config

        @NotNull
public static @NotNull Path config()
        Directory which can use used to store configuration data:
        • Win: %USERPROFILE%/AppData/Local;
        • Unix: $XDG_CONFIG_HOME (default: $HOME/.config).
        Usually you'd like to invoke resolve("<appname>") on return value to create subdirectory.
        Returns:
        path to config directory
        Throws:
        NoSuchPathException - if it's impossible to acquire path to directory

      • data

        @NotNull
public static @NotNull Path data()
        Directory which can use used to store data:
        • Win: %USERPROFILE%/AppData/Roaming;
        • Unix: $HOME/.local/share.
        Note that Windows will sync changes with domain server. If not desired, Consider using dataLocal() instead.

        Usually you'd like to invoke resolve("<appname>") on return value to create subdirectory.

        Returns:
        path to config directory
        Throws:
        NoSuchPathException - if it's impossible to acquire path to directory

      • dataLocal

        @NotNull
public static @NotNull Path dataLocal()
        Directory which can use used to store data:
        • Win: %USERPROFILE%/AppData/Local;
        • Unix: $HOME/.local/share.
        Usually you'd like to invoke resolve("<appname>") on return value to create subdirectory.
        Returns:
        path to config directory
        Throws:
        NoSuchPathException - if it's impossible to acquire path to directory

      • temp

        @NotNull
public static @NotNull Path temp()
        Temp files directory:
        • Win: %USERPROFILE%/AppData/Local/Temp;
        • Unix: /tmp.
        Returns:
        path to home directory
        Throws:
        NoSuchPathException - if it's impossible to acquire path to directory
